json.text:
The Beginner's Strategy for Building Authority
Online
... and commanding premium prices
MAY 18, 2025
10 Share
The old way of selling online is dead.
Bombarding people with ads and hoping something sticks is an expensive gam
The new path to revenue isn‚Äôt shouting louder than your competition. It‚Äôs
establishing genuine authority in your niche.
And the simplest way to establish authority online is to become the informatio
source for your ideal customer.
TUHIN PATRA
39

When you create a body of content that proactively solves the pain points your
ideal customer has, or teaches them something that makes their lives better, th
feel connected and are much more likely to respond to your offer.
This is exactly how HubSpot stood out in a highly saturated and competitive S
market ‚Äî by creating high-quality, in-depth content.
And once you establish yourself as the go-to authority in your niche, everythin
your business becomes easier.
You no longer chase clients. They seek you out.
Your sales conversations shift from convincing people of your value to
discussing how you‚Äôll work together.
You can charge premium prices because the ideal customer already recogn
your expertise.
Every entrepreneur worth their salt knows this.
They start creating content with lots of enthusiasm, with the goal of becoming
authority in their niche.
Yet most of them never get there. Why?
They chase trends, react to random ideas, and write about whatever inspires th
that week.
I call them content hamsters, forever running on the hamster wheel of reactiv
creation, starting from zero each time thinking ‚ÄúWhat should I write about this
week?‚Äù
99% of online creators are reactive

As a result, their content feels scattered, their audience feels confused, and the
can‚Äôt point to a clear territory they own.
Six months on, they‚Äôre frustrated. The growth plateaus despite working twice
hard, until they eventually burn out and quit.
The fact is, they make content creation a lot harder than it needs to be.
I call them authority builders.
What I‚Äôve learned studying successful creators is that authority isn‚Äôt just abou
creating good content.
It‚Äôs about systematically covering a territory.
Hang on a sec, it‚Äôll become clear.
Authority builders understand that each piece of content serves a specific
purpose.
They might publish less frequently, but everything they create strategically bu
their position as the go-to expert.
Their content forms a cohesive body of work that naturally leads prospects tow
their offers.
They work from systems, not inspiration.
Only 1% of creators online create with intentio
and strategy

Think about someone you consider an authority in their field.
Go through their content carefully, and you‚Äôd see they organize their content i
4-5 broad themes.
These are the things they wish to be known for, also known as content pillars
Take Justin Welsh, one of the most authoritative voices on solopreneurship as
example.
His content is strategically organized around six pillars:
1. Personal Growth
2. Business Planning
3. Personal Branding
4. Social Media Growth
5. Monetizing Knowledge
6. Productivity & Time Management
Marking your territory, or as the geeks call it:
‚Äúidentifying your topic taxonomy‚Äú

Similarly, James Clear divides his content into 8 authority pillars:
1. Creativity
2. Decision Making
3. Focus
4. Habits
5. Life Lessons
6. Motivation
7. Productivity
8. Self Improvement

Once these top creators identify the major themes, they define 5-10 specific to
under each pillar that their ideal customers genuinely care about.
These are more specific, and often address particular pain points or aspiration
For example, Justin‚Äôs ‚ÄúBusiness Planning‚Äù can be broadly classified into these
pillars:
1. Finding a profitable niche
2. Crafting a business roadmap
3. Becoming a solopreneur
4. Solopreneur business models
5. Defining your mission and goals

This carefully mapped territory (topic taxonomy) covers everything his ideal
audience needs to know about building a successful one-person business.
Each piece of content he publishes strengthens his claim on this territory.
When someone discovers his work through a LinkedIn post about ‚Äúfinding you
profitable niche,‚Äù they naturally discover his other content about business
planning, social media growth, and monetization.
The result?
Justin is now recognized as one of the definitive authorities on building a
solopreneur business online, making millions in digital product sales, all with
spending a dime on paid advertising.
Now that you know what topic taxonomy is, and why it‚Äôs important, let‚Äôs see h
to create yours using AI.
This prompt works best with Deep Research models like ChatGPT‚Äôs Deep
Research and Gemini Deep Research.
Open up a new research window and paste the below prompt:
How to create topic taxonomy using AI
<Role>:
You are an expert market researcher tasked with generating a carefully
structured topic taxonomy specifically tailored to my brand. The goal
to establish myself as the go-to authority in my niche by creating
strategic, connected content that positions me as the definitive
resource for my ideal customers.
I will provide the following detailed brand documents for your analysi
1. Unique Value Proposition (UVP)

2. Ideal Reader Persona (audience demographics, behaviors, goals,
interests)
3. Key Pain Points faced by the Ideal Reader
<Task>:
Your goal is to deeply research, analyze, and propose a comprehensive
topic taxonomy to guide content ideation and ensure alignment with the
brand‚Äôs UVP and the ideal audience‚Äôs needs and pain points.
Structure your taxonomy clearly as follows:
Level 1 (Pillar): Identify 4-6 primary pillars that directly align wit
the brand‚Äôs UVP and strongly address the audience‚Äôs pain points.
These should be broad enough to encompass multiple sub-topics but
specific enough to claim a distinct territory.
Provide a brief rationale explicitly connecting each pillar to the
brand‚Äôs UVP and the ideal reader's identified pain points.
Level 2 (Sub-pillars/Clusters): Under each pillar, propose 5-10 focuse
sub-pillars or clusters.
These should address specific pain points, questions, or aspirations m
audience has.
For each sub-pillar, include a concise rationale that clearly links it
to both its parent pillar and audience pain points.
Level 3 (Specific Topics/Questions): Within each sub-pillar, list 3-5
specific, actionable, and engaging topics or questions that resonate
with the ideal audience and address their specific concerns or
interests.
<Important Guidelines>:
* Your output must be based entirely on the provided brand documents.
* Clearly state your rationale for each level, linking explicitly back
to the UVP and audience pain points.
* If the provided documentation is unclear or insufficient for confide
taxonomy generation, explicitly state any uncertainties and request
additional clarifications from the user rather than guessing.

Paste your UVP, Ideal reader persona, and their pain points at the designated
places.
Check this article in case you need help creating any of the above.
Answer any follow-up questions the model asks and wait for the results.
<Output Format>:
Present your findings strictly in the following structured format:
Level 1 ‚Äì Pillar #1: [Name of Pillar]
- Rationale (briefly connect pillar to UVP & pain points)
- Level 2 ‚Äì Sub-pillar #1:
- Rationale (connection to Pillar & audience pain points)
- Level 3: Specific topics/questions:
1. [Specific topic/question]
2. [Specific topic/question]
3. [Specific topic/question]
- Level 2 ‚Äì Sub-pillar #2:
- Rationale
- Level 3: Specific topics/questions:
1. ...
2. ...
3. ...
(Continue clearly through all pillars)
<UVP>:
[Paste your UVP here]
<Ideal Reader Persona>:
[Paste your ideal reader persona here]
<Key Pain Points>:
[Paste your ideal reader's pain points here]
#####
Please begin by thoroughly analyzing the provided documents and reques
clarification immediately if you encounter insufficient detail or
ambiguity to ensure maximum accuracy and relevance of your taxonomy
proposal.

Here‚Äôs a pillar it generated for a hypothetical business that sells turmeric-base
health drink:
The pillars are broad and evergreen, and each has a few specific sub-themes.
For instance, under Lifestyle & Recipes, sub-topics like ‚Äúpre-workout mockta
or ‚Äúgolden-milk lattes‚Äù indicate recurring content ideas (perhaps a series of re
posts or lifestyle tips centred on those themes).
Notice how each sub-theme is narrow enough to be interesting, but not so nar
that you‚Äôd run out of content ideas.
Pretty solid!
Store your taxonomy in a document and use it in your next ideation session.
The question is no longer ‚ÄúWhat should I write about this week?‚Äù
You simply look at the map and ask ‚ÄúWhich part of my territory needs strengtheni
right now?‚Äù
Do not just ask the AI to produce article ideas. Specify the pillar and subpillar
you‚Äôd want to create content around.
How to use your territory map to build authorit

The aim is to produce enough content under each pillar that someone explorin
your site could get a full education on that theme.
When creating content, use your taxonomy to create meta tags and on-page SE
Include pillar keywords in category pages, and sub-topic keywords in titles an
headings.
Remember, this taxonomy is just the first draft. Over time, you may need to tw
your taxonomy. Maybe one pillar isn‚Äôt performing or you discover a new pillar
emerging from audience feedback.
Schedule periodic check-ins to evaluate if your taxonomy still reflects your
content and audience interests. If you pivot your business, the taxonomy shou
pivot with you.
Here‚Äôs what happens when you implement a strategic topic taxonomy:
1. Your content creation becomes effortless. No more wondering what to wr
about. Your map guides you.
2. Your audience starts recognizing patterns in your content. They begin to
associate you with specific expertise territories and return to you for more
information.
3. Search engines start trusting your site on certain topics. When a website
covers a subject in great detail through many interrelated pieces, Google
starts viewing it as an authority on that subject.
You transform from just another content creator into a recognized authority,
someone whose opinion matters, whose expertise is valued, and whose offers
Iterate
From scattered content to genuine authority

command premium prices.
So ask yourself: Are you still running on the content hamster wheel, or are you
ready to start building with intention?
Thanks for reading Deep Writing! Subscribe for
more actionable strategies to build AI-powered
content systems and grow your business.

json.html:
Article Ideas

1. How to Escape the Content Hamster Wheel: Building a Systematic Content Machine

This article will expose the pitfalls of reactive, inspiration-led content creation and walk solopreneurs through steps to move toward an intentional, system-driven approach. It will cover the transition from scattered output to a cohesive, authority-building content strategy, including mapping core themes and leveraging repeatable processes.

********************************

2. Topic Taxonomy 101: The Secret Structure Behind Authority-Building Content

This piece will introduce readers to the concept of topic taxonomies‚Äîhow authority creators map out content pillars, sub-pillars, and supporting topics to strategically cover their territory online. It will provide actionable guidance on identifying and creating a taxonomy tailored to the reader‚Äôs niche, highlighting its benefits for perceived authority and business growth.

********************************

3. Leveraging AI for Strategic Content Planning: Move Beyond Random Hacks to Integrated Workflows

This article will address the audience‚Äôs frustration with disjointed, one-off AI tools by presenting a step-by-step process for using AI to develop a strategic content plan. It will show how to connect brand documents, audience pain points, and AI-powered research to build a long-term, voice-consistent content pipeline.

********************************

4. From Expertise to Influence: Monetizing Your Knowledge With Authority-Driven Content

This article will lay out the path solopreneurs can take to transform unstructured expertise into revenue-generating content products. It will explain how building authority through cohesive, audience-aligned content leads to opportunities for premium offers, productized services, and digital courses‚Äîmaking scaling possible without sacrificing expertise or voice.

********************************

5. Periodic Content Audits: Keeping Your Authority Pillars Relevant and Resonant

This article will teach solopreneurs how‚Äîand why‚Äîto regularly evaluate and refine their content taxonomy. It‚Äôll provide a practical framework for reviewing pillar performance, incorporating audience feedback, and ensuring each theme continues to support their business growth and online reputation over time.

********************************
